div.p:
The Feature Value Observation consists of a group of elements encompassing different types of information describing the details of the realization of a specific feature value in a specific place or places according to a source. Thus, every Feature Value Observation must have:
At least one place element
One unique feature value
One unique source
The occurrence of multiple values or of multiple sources will then result in the creation of additional Feature Value Observations. Every Feature Value Observation is identifiable by a unique xml ID.

Additionally, the Feature Value Observation may contain other optional elements:
One or several Person Group element(s) of different types (tribe, age, religion, sociolinguistic perception and mother tongue) that further specifies information about the speakers from whom the realization of a feature value has been observed or documented in the source.
One or several Language Profile element, linking the Feature Value Observation to a VICAV Profile
One or several Source Representation element(s), where literal information from the source is quoted in its original form (e.g. original reflexes of some items as documented by the author in the original source featuring the source's transcription system.)
One or several examples to illustrate a feature value, as taken from the original source and with their English translation.
One or several notes to clarify specificities, exceptions,and constraints concerning the realization of a feature value.
